content: Update: I've uninstalled the app and now use Amazon through a bookmarked page in Chrome. This is much faster and I definitely recommend it. The app now crashes constantly. Ever since the latest update, the app takes much longer to load and crashes constantly. It's trying to do too much. I don't need to see sale deals, suggested items, prime video ads, and more on the first page. All of this clutters the app and makes it run slower. It needs to be streamlined.

New update is awful. As others have mentioned, when I click on an item the ‚ù§Ô∏è to save to a list is only available on the original color/ style/ size/ etc. Once another size/ color is chosen, the option to save to a list disappears. PLEASE FIX. Also the new way my lists are displayed is confusing and hard to find the list I'm looking for. If it ain't broke, don't fix it. Please put it back the way it was.

Good functionality overall. The List feature is clutch, which isn't unique to the app. The Cart itself could use an over-haul in its design, though; like multiple carts (for people who like to budget & prolly others, as well); Save to List> from Saved For Later; a one-page checkout option (like Buy Now) but for your whole cart, instead of a 3? page checkout. I understand the need for confirmation but I think it's a little much. I use this app all the time, though; should prolly be 4 stars.

You ruined a good app! This app worked perfectly, but now I need to use a PC to shop... the screen is too large for the tablet, and like others mention, requires scrolling around to see pictures and the entire screen. The search bar is at the bottom - why? And the lists no longer work on my tablet. Roll back to the previous version and don't mess it up.

Going to the lists sections should be less taps. Why would you add a collection of EVERY item saved in individual lists to one page, then make that the default when you click on "lists" instead of the screen that shows all of the lists themselves? More taps, more annoying than using just the browser instead of this Otherwise, app is decent to navigate and constrain searches, basically on par with Ebay's app's flow. Which still isn't great.

Amazon is okay but searching is the absolute worst in the industry. You cannot get amazon to allow you to filter anything. It was also, just now, selecting departments I did not want it to select, thus limiting my results to a smaller area. Like they do this on purpose. It will not actually sort by price, brand, or rating. You get results that all mixed up. This makes for a very bad shopping experience. I have to research outside Amazon then get what I want for a product. I wish they would fix

The newest UI update is horrible. The forced search bar at the bottom was a huge mistake. If people want it at the bottom there should be an option to switch from top or bottom in the settings. Another gripe I have with it is that looking at your shopping lists is bugged out, because I cannot scroll through the list to find something I saved. Amazon please consider fixing your app.

Some of Amazon's products are 100% awesome. However when I tried to review the product, took a video and picture to show how awesome it was, and how happy I was with my purchase, the submit button was never bold. Their sight needs some serious work. The search bar at the bottom, and the new lists version is horrible. Please Uninstall this new update.

Latest update removes any sort-by option at all...removed the "sort by price" functionality several years ago, which could be slightly worked around by drilling down to a specific category. Now that workaround isn't even effective, and you can no longer sort by seller. Sponsored results are crammed into your search results feed which makes it hard to even see the real results if there aren't very many. Overall, this thing tries to get you clicking on ads more than clicking on what you came for

Boycotted this scam company. I was at check out page and probably clicked Amazon Prime as the shipping option. Only ever bought one thing, then left it untouched for months. It's only when I checked back my bank account there's a constant $2.99 fee charged over 9 months. What?! We are subscribed automatically just by checking out one item?!?! Called in customer service, just told me to cancel it myself and they are unable to refund me for the subscription. Never leave card details with them!!!!

Buggy and limited. It's nice to have access to Amazon from my phone, but the webapp used lacks a lot of the features you find on the site (which is silly since this is mostly just a frameview for the website and not a full featured app). It sometimes overflows outside of the view window so scrolling gets really weird since it'll move a bit to the left and right, constant error messages where something went wrong, filters in searches are sometimes broken, and lots more issues, it's just a mess.

Quite frankly, I'm impressed that this app somehow manages to get worse with every update. I can't decide which is my favorite feature, the obnoxious videos that make looking at a product nearly impossible or spending more time hunting down the "categories" menu than actually shopping. At this point, I can't tell if y'all are trying to reinvent the wheel, or encourage me to shop with walmart.

Recent update is terrible. The font color for the search box is White with a white background. so who knows what I'm searching. Plus all of the fields to select When cIicking on have a yellow background with a white color font. This makes for limited Contrast and very difficult reading for people who have perfect visual acuity... so think of people who have less than perfect vision. Changes to the entire Color scheme and rearranging the entire format was a bad idea!

It doesn't matter how an app works when the service provided by Amazon is poor. Out of my last 5 orders, 2 delivered to another address (with photo proof), 1 not dispatched by Amazon with no explanation and 1 allegedly I rejected delivery (I didn't). At a time when the cost of prime has increased the service has deteriorated. On top of that slow to refund or sort replacement when it does go wrong. Amazon used to have a ethos of providing quality service but that no longer seems the case.

ATTENTION EVERYONE THAT IS HAVING ISSUES WITH THE RECENT CHANGES TO THE AMAZON APP: I was having the same issues. I un-installed then reinstalled the app on my tablet, and it fixed it!! Now the Amazon app is back to the way it used be before it changed. Please try un-installing it, then reinstall it on your phone or tablet. It worked for me. Now it looks like the app version and not the website version.

App UI design is beyond trash. Annoying to find what lists I want, fooling me into buying something multiple times accidentally because the "add to cart" function sometimes is unresponsive and place order page is hard to look at because nothing stands out (the order total should be at the bottom of the page), and putting the search bar at the bottom of the screen for some reason; no need to change what's been the norm for years.

Terrible app. Constantly says "uh oh something went wrong on our end." I've been trying to add a gift card that I received for my birthday on JUNE 16TH, but I still can't get it added to my account. It is one of the slowest and overall worst shopping apps you can get. Their service and shipping have gone downhill as well. I always LOVED Amazon, but I don't think it's worth the hassle anymore. Will be canceling my membership again, as well.

Amazon as a whole has been pretty good until recently. It seems like less items are being delivered in that 2 day delivery window as time goes on. Also have had items become undeliverable multiple times in one month now. It's becoming harder to justify purchasing prime unfortunately. If they offered a military discount for active duty personnel then I would consider renewing but as it stands... I will not be. As a service it's just fine without prime. Customer service has always been solid.

This new update is a pain in the azz! Why is the search bar at the bottom?? That's not what bothers me the most but I want to understand why you would make the choice to put the bar in the least familiar place possible. WHY do you feature all those toggles at the bottom for the same thing?? I just want to modify my shipping address, not uncover the lost city of Atlantis. I use this app to shop then leave. I don't want to have to fiddle with the entire app for simple changes.

App keeps encountering errors with go to homepage button when trying to do anything. Force stop, cleared cache, cleared user data. None of those worked. Uninstall and reinstall it worked for a short while but once the error occurs it cannot be recovered, and now not even reinstall works. Error page just shows "CS2" phone reboot also does not help.

Stop screwing with apps that work. The new update stinks and harder to find list, orders, etc. Now you had to screw with the product didn't you. The page looks like it does on the Web site. Page doesn't fit the screen and you have to scroll back and forth to view the missing part of the page. You can't zoom in like you could. The extended image page you can get is like the website, worthless. And why would you move the search bar to the bottom of the page????. Do the IT people ever use the app?

Amazon has buried the prime" end prime membership " making it difficult to end prime. I finally had to go to the help section to find the link to cancel. It may just be my devices ( phone & tablet) However, I've not had this issue before now. It should be under manage your. Membership, under that tab, it doesn't give the option to cancel. Whew, I'm exhausted from trying to trying, I'm going to take a rest ....... üò¥

As of today, the app pages are the same as the website. So why bother with the app?! To make matters worse, I can now no longer zoom in and out on the website, which I could never do on the app (and still can't.) I am vision impaired and have my tablet setting set to enlarge everything to enable me to see what's on the screen. The app and website now only allow me to see a small portion of the screen, making it impossible to use. Making so-called improvements more often makes it worse.

Way over priced! Once you get into a prime membership, Amazon makings it very challenging to cancel it. I canceled through the app, was still charged, called Amazon, spoke to 4 different incompetent reps none of whom could cancel the membership and i was redirected to the google store app where i still could not fond a way to cancel. it came down to me calling my credit card company and disputing the charge and blocking. Ridiculous to jump though hoops to cancel, and AWFUL customer service!

App is great! However I don't know who needs to hear this at Amazon, but it is getting harder and harder to find what we are looking for. Your algorithm to shove at us what you need to sell vs. what we are looking for has crossed the line of obscene. Sometimes, you have to go 3 and 4 pages deep to even find a comparable product. Good luck, but I find myself going back to the box stores, paying more for shipping and the product, just for the convenience of finding what I want.

The new update is almost ENTIRELY UNUSABLE. Text and images are often cut from off of the screen and cannot be seen in neither portrait nor landscape mode on mobile. I cannot access the list of used item sellers, if there is an option for buying used, there is only one listing showing on the products main page; despite showing that there are more options than just that one used item & seller available for the product. This is trash and I hope I can rollback to a previous version of the app.

I wish people here reviewed the APP, not Amazon. Amazon's great, the app not so much. Edit 3/28/2023: the app is usable once more, so back to 2.5 stars. My main gripe is always how slow and increasingly bloated is the app, but I doubt they will ever optimize it. Using it mainly to monitor the status of orders, otherwise I would uninstall it. I use my PC for browsing and to place orders. Faster that way.

The app has become slightly unusable. I can't add anything to my lists, everything is too large when viewing an item meaning I have to slide from left to right just to add to cart and etc. Descriptions are now squished together to take up less space? The app looks more like the Amazon PC website which isn't a good thing for mobile devices. It's very unfortunate.

They just changed the app so that when you search something, the entire screen is occupied by a single result. The text runs off, but you can show me a giant image? I have to lose my place every time I want to know if the result is even accurate to what I searched. I hope you idiots are happy bc this is the only review I'll ever write for this app. Fixing it will not make me feel like writing something again.

App is easy to use & I can find anything I need. 2 issues: reviews & filter. Most of the time, the reviews have NOTHING to do with the product I'm viewing. It's rediculous that Amazon can't attach the right reviews to the right product. I don't like throwing üí∞ away on products of poor quality or don't work. Reviews are important. Filter includes items that are unrelated to the search. It's not that hard categorizing products and Amazon has been doing this long enough to get these right.

I like Amazon for the most part (even tho here lately I've found cheaper prices elsewhere), but the app leaves a lot to be desired. Options to change btw lists was removed and if you look at a different variety, the link to save it vanishes altogether. It's also very laggy and takes forever to load. Googling Amazon products is simpler. Canceled prime bc it is pointless. Never get anything delivered within 2 days or an option for it on most products anymore. Amazon needs to chill with updates.

(March 2023)I hate updated version! What was wrong with the way it was? Can't see all information when I click on an item. I have to move it back and forth. Picture of item won't zoom anymore. Ugh ( August 2023) Another update! NOT USER FRIENDLY!!!Search bar on the bottom??? Item I click on won't fit on my tablet or phone screen. I'm thinking about deleting app. So frustrating!

I only use this for support chat & to call support. Shopping through a browser is superior, because you can have multiple tabs open, which by comparison, makes the app rather useless. To add insult to injury, I uninstall this app after every support contact, b/C or else weblinks will open in this app & I don't shop using it. PITA! Searching is a PITA too! Filtering / key words / search operators are total junk when you're looking for very specific stuff. Tons of irrelevant results wasting time.

I hate that when I put in a year make and model of a car. It shows parts. Not for that vehicle.. now I got wrong parts because the app just throws parts on the screen.. and returning it is gonna suck. I hope the other stuff I ordered is correct.. if not no need for this app in my phone . But I'm sure others feel the same . Parts show up just because that company is paying for advertising. That's some bull

Don't know what you did recently, but now my app won't operate at all! I still get notifications, but I can't check them. Trying to access anything results in an endless pinwheel & nothing else. Tried to uninstall/reinstall, but now I can't even sign back in! I relied on this app for many things over the past few years, but now it's completely useless.

Uninstalling and reinstalling... Unable to make purchases. All of a sudden not working correctly, skips payment method, and gets stuck in a update address loop for each individual item in the cart!? Closed/reopened, cleared cache, changed cart contents, restarted phone, and now trying to install app. But I doubt it will work. If it does I will update this review, until then it's 0 stars.

Frustrated and Disappointed with Amazon's new layout. I am basically shopping daily on Amazon, and now it's no fun. The pages are WAY to jumbled with so much stuff that I can't even see the items that I want to purchase. It truly is miserable to even attempt to see what the sellers different options are for the item your looking at. Feels like I lost a friend. I can't believe that anyone could possibly think that this new mess is more user friendly.

Update 8/19/23: better. Not saying error or "oops! Something went wrong, etc". 6/6/23 Never had an issue with the app until today. Each time I open the app, it says something went wrong return to Amazon home & when I click on it, it goes blank/white. Or it loads one of my lists I go into and after 2 minutes it's saying the same thing. I'd like this fixed so I can send people ideas for our daughter's 1st birthday please.

1. "your orders" screen has never worked. refuses to load. 2. paid $10 for overnight shipping and the package isn't here, was told it was 10 stops away and now it won't show me where it is? then amazon says "you can cancel it and get a refund" except i can't cancel it now, the button has vanished. I was able to cancel it last night but now conveniently it has disappeared. cool.

This app suuuuuuucks. Millions of fake reviews. They sell items from the same people that sell on AliExpress. And way too many disruptive sponsored ads. And why is it that when I use the filter on this app, it adds more items. Shouldn't it's subtract items to make it easier for me to find what I'm looking for faster? Amazon can learn a thing or two about Walmart's app. Until they fix all these problems, I suggest you stay away from this app.

Photos aren't loading. Whenever I click on any photo or video they simply won't load. My connection is fine. I've tried wireless as well as 5g. Not being able to see a clearer zoomed in photo or watch a video review of some things we are looking to purchase though defeats the purpose of having a convenient app.

The way the star ratings now show in search is useless and makes finding good items that much more difficult. Used to be you could see at a glance how many stars (visually represented by actual stars), and the total number of ratings (shown as a number). This would allow you to easily find products that have been used and liked by many people. Now you need to click into the listing to see this. Awful update.

Please fix latest "update"!!! App apparently no longer recognizes the size of my screen, so it makes me scroll right to see price, add to cart, etc., plus when I enlarge images the left third or so is cut off and it will not allow scrolling to the left to see the whole image. And it doesn't allow pinching in and out to avoid all this nonsense either. I'll shop again when it's less work. And the heart is gone, which allowed quickly adding to wish list.

Used to have a save to list button on all listings. Now, some listings have a save to list, and some dont. For example, you find the curtian you want the color is black, but you want the grey. The black one is tge only one with a heart in the corner. They grey option does not have a heart, and you have no way of saving it to your list. I dont like the new updat. Gimme my old version back!

I don't like the new update as I am partially sighted, and the old version was much more user friendly . You were able to zoom in better, I also have my font bigger on my tablet so now half of the screen image is missing which wasn't before!!! essential for me!! I order a lot from amazon but if this is how it's staying I will look for alternative means of purchase!!! VERY DISSAPOINTED!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Not a reflection on the app. App is solid. I'm just so frustrated with Amazon's shipping lately. Used to be great but all year my stuff comes late. And worse it doesn't give me a new expected delivery date most of the time. Was supposed to have some lights for my car arrive 3 days ago and it still says running late. Won't even give me a new expected arrival time

The reason I'm heavily downgrading this app is the very stupid interface handling links from emails or Google app. I look for a product in Google app & there is a listing for a product from Amazon. I click on the link, it calls the app, but never goes directly to the linked product. Usually, though not always, there is not even a list of possible candidates for the description - that's bad. I emailed a link to print a label, clicked the link, and it doesn't go to the print label page - stupid!

An aggravating experience. Their customer service is lousy. I have been flagged unnecesarily twice for making purchases, and then locked out for it. Trying to get someome to give me access again has been time consuming. Like a lot of companies, they prefer to use an automated system which takes too much time to navigate. Not happy at all.

I don't know if it's this was part of the new update, but Alexa doesn't respond to voice command anymore. I tried uninstalling and reinstalling it twice, it works for about two seconds and then it stops and a notification shows that I have to press the mic in order to search for something. I can no longer say ALEXA search for shoes or whatever I'm searching for. They should also put the search bar back at the top

Very glitchy lately. Installed the update and no improvement. Sometimes takes AGES to do anything, like looking at my orders or opening an image. Sometimes I have to wait several minutes for it to load all the adverts before it will reveal reviews. I suspect too much power or algorithms are too busy trying to load adverts of other things it thinks I might want to buy (or very random things that other people have bought üòÇ), that it can't cope with loading the page I actually want.

The app tries to work like the website now but A) if I want to have the website experience I'm going to use the website B) 90% of the time I end up with "page doesn't exist" when trying to add anything to my wishlist or shopping cart You can scroll through pictures anymore or two the heart to add something to your list. Terrible shopping experience.

You'll be able to find all sorts of stuff on here and most them have reviews. The thing I like about this app is that you can select filters to find exactly what you're looking for. I've never used Amazon prime before because thats a scam and they don't send their packages faster though that so just have it shipped regularly than you'll be ok.

Subscribe and Save is easy to sign up for and hard to manage. Amazon made managing Subscribe and Save subscriptions harder to find on app, which makes changing or canceling items harder. It would seem if they wanted loyalty with buying products, they would make it more user friendly. UNLESS it is part of a way to get people to subscribe to take their money, and make the function harder to use to keep taking their money without caring about the customer.

Still loads very slowly, refreshes all the time, doesn't do a good job at sharing list suggestions based on lists shared with you by someone else. Does a great job showing you the same exact product 900 times from different sources recommended the same exact thing you already said no to. Continue where you left off saying no is nice. And as we add more stuff to a hearted list or any list at all the personalization is to specific.

08/21/23: Tracking orders for Whole Foods (WF) cannot be done from the WF page; you have go to the Amazon Orders page. I should be able to track orders directly from WF page by clicking the "You" icon. 12/18/22: Search Filters do not work. Setting the filter for items from 100$-200$ still gives me items for 300$-600$ Why? Filters also adds items that are not remotely related to the search filter. If I search for VCRs, it shows me AV signal converters. Why? I want accurate filters.

I'm finding less and less reason to use Amazon when physical stores near me are often 10% to 25% cheaper after taxes than Amazon's prices before taxes. High end, low end, doesn't matter. Mom n pop shops, big box stores, they're all cheaper than Amazon now. As for the app, it's VERY laggy, and the buttons aren't recognizing input unless you happen to hit a specific pixel or something. Using a web browser instead improves the speed and clicks. Please drop your prices by like 50%.

DON'T UPGRADE! Even...slower...still... Why didn't I take my own advice from before! Delays are so bad you end up clicking buttons other than what's displayed! Awful app now! From 2021: Newer versions of app are getting worse and worse. Hangs often when trying to add to cart or add to wishlist. Gets my phone REALLY HOT and kills my battery quickly. Didn't do this a year ago! I buy less on Amazon because the app is failing! Please fix it!

The app is extremely buggy and clunky. It's difficult to find anything in your settings; the amount of categories and sections in your account is honestly overwhelming. One issue I've been experiencing for months now is the inability to look at my order history. Sometimes it will work, but more often than not, when I select "Orders", the page glitches and starts flashing while endlessly trying to load. The orders never show, and I end up having to go onto my browser if I want to access them.

While prime shipping is nice, the rampant scams and misleading listings are everywhere and Amazon constantly premotes garbage products at the top of every search result. I really enjoyed prime when I first got it but now I've been burned enough by sellers sending me a defective product then disappearing. Such a shame Amazon sees there customers as nothing more then their wallets.

Search function in automotive just sucks. Even if you have specific vehicles loaded, it still doesn't filter or show correctly and offers parts for other cars which is just plain stupid. What's the point of entering filters if it doesn't..uhm let's see.. filter? I gave up on trying to use the phone app for car parts as it just doesn't work and drives me crazy. Just end up using Ebay since it works.

Honestly, I never had an issue with this app, it works for me alright. My issue is with the company. I have never endured such incompetence. I got locked out of my account they apparently couldn't update My account, I got hacked so there is no way to fight it at all now so I'm stuck. Which sucks because I enjoyed so many features and luxuries of Amazon prime, but if they cannot help their customers than they are just useless

Latest update and app still unusable, lots of sideways scrolling and very poor scaling. Looks like a bad attempt at i-framing the website version. Can't see add to cart, can't view images as only right hand half of images visible. Seriously Amazon, 4 weeks and still not fixed, your website has the same issues on android browsers, eg Chrome etc. Same display issues across all devices from Lenovo to Huawei.

This is the most bullcrap thing I have experienced, I have ordered multiple things and quite a few items have just disappeared, not to mention the entire cart just disappeared as well. When I ordered the things that didn't show up, it said the order was on hold but showed up normally but when clicked on it deleted. I honestly think this is a code run by a middle schooler, Everyone reading the reviews boycott it, and just go buy your things at other websites and stores. This is a complete waist.

App now has multiple display failures on all devices since last week. Have to scroll sideways right to see add to cart button. Can only see one half of each product image, the other half sits off screen to left and you can't scroll left. Can't see reviews, questions etc. App completely unusable across all devices. Updates haven't helped.

I haven't experienced any issues/changes regarding adding things to various lists (which I have a lot of). The link is easy to overlook though. My huge issue for the past couple months is suddenly now you can't go to another user's profile, browse their reviews, and actually know what product the review is for. There's no link to the product or name/title of product to go with the reviews. Super upsetting since browsing users reviews is a fav way to discover new stuff based off reviewers style

I hate that when I add something to my wish list I don't get to choose the list is goes to initially. I love shopping but that feature is so frustrating. I have to go make a new list and then go through the default list and move everything over. I can't even select more then one item to move. It would be great if when I select the ‚ù§Ô∏è it would ask me which place to save it and or to create a new wish list. Now I hate that the search bar is at the bottom wth!

The app is good however the one problem I've had with it is when it's talking about delivery it'll tell you like it'll be there before 10:00 p.m. and it used to tell you how close the delivery was to you. But the last two items I ordered I did not get the notification on my app that had been delivered. Outside of that it's okay. Go back to the old list. This new one is just too confusing. As everybody says if it ain't broke don't fix it.

The new AI driven support system won't let me report a stolen package. Amazon allows their drivers to drop off packages without pictures attached and then claim they won't pay to ship a replacement because the item was delivered. Prime eligible products frequently advertise two day shipping and then don't arrive for up to ten days. If there was a reasonable alternative to Amazon I would switch, and I've been seriously considering cancelling my prime subscription.

Delivery is quick and great.. rest is just disappointing... Items are over priced for knock off that don't function correctly.. Better off using wish and waiting a few extra weeks for the same quality items. Way cheaper. And better refund options.. Amazon asks how they can make it right... but only give one option... so why bother asking... its nonsense..

I have no idea if i found some magical customization function hidden in their encyclopedia's worth of menu items or if the update just transformed into a completely different app, but i dont have time to thumb my way around everything again to find the features i use .... Seems like the method of changing things a little at a time was disregarded.

Pretty well written app, with intentional design choices. Like, the lack of different notification channels for delivery updates vs. sale promotions vs. account notifications etc. Of the smart one among you thought "how will they disable promotional notifications if they have a o disable delivery updates too?". To you I say, I'll disable every notification and zombify your app. I'll use it when I feel like. Good job!

Stop it. Just stop it. Stop adding useless, bogging down "features" that just create frustration. The fact that I have to jump through 50 hoops just to get to a prime menu, let alone sit through a load time longer than my morning constitutional just to get to my order history, is just plain poor design. Update your security when needed, fix a bug when able, and then leave it the hell alone.

Fix your damn app, Jeff Bezos, before you piss off anymore of your customers. App is not even usable anymore. App keeps crashing on me. Went and reinstalled the app. Now it takes forever to get to sign in screen, and I can't even sign in because the app still crashes after about 15 - 30 seconds. Guess it is staying uninstalled until they fix this issue. I thought updates were supposed to make the app better?

This app is trash. Slowly but surely things were changing around and I was learning to deal with it. Now I'm fed up. Because I'm not able to save things I look at to my lists anymore. I click on something, and the save button is there. But when I look at a different color or a different pattern of the same thing, the save button disappears. Hey Amazon if its not broke DON'T FIX IT!!!! All these changes are unnecessary and now there are things missing that used to be there.

Absolutely awful filtering system for orders. Really needs an update, it used to be that all shipped/ arriving that day we're at the very top and all orders that hadn't been shipped or had already been delivered were further at the bottom. It would be nice if there was a filtering system that also had delivered & delivered today to better keep track of orders that have shipped and arrived. Absolutely terrible, can't stand this new system

Amazon, in general, has gone downhill. Whether shopping on the app or the webpage, item quality, item availability, customer service, and the prime benefits have all become utter trash. I'm kind of glad that it's gotten so bad -- once I delete the app, I wont impulse shop as much, and I won't be paying $100+ for the practically worthless prime membership anymore.

Appalling update. Updated app on Samsung tablet this morning. Used to be able to see whole screen- gone! Only see 3/4 screen page now. Used to be able to easily scroll similar products- gone! Now have to click a button to scroll left or right. May as well use the Web page, as App is no easier. What dummy thought this was a good update... it isn't!

Update 8/10/23: The app WAS fine and functioned well with buttons that were useful. After the recent update, don't like the app anymore. The "inspire" button (light bulb icon) is useless, lists are "grouped" where I can't readily click the list I want (before: all your lists under 1 tab, all your friends' lists under the other tab, SIMPLE), can't add your own idea anymore, and now no more drag/drop to organize items in lists. Disappointed.

In 2019 I gave this 5 stars. After this recent update I give it 1 star, if I could I'd give it 0. This is the perfect example why I go months or even years to update an app. I already didn't like the way the previous update looked. But this one gives completely asinine results, the search bar is on the bottom, and it's difficult to select prime only.

If you could make it easier to change a phone number, that would be swell. I don't have access to my old number so no OTP for me but there's no other way to verify myself except a government ID?
